page.title: 05A Vets Day (J.Bell)
page.content: It is soon after 7 and so far the phone has not rung,like two days ago when I had to rush from my cosy bed to an early morning milk fever.If I hurry I can feed my young calves and quickly check my small flock of sheep,before grabbing a bowl of cereal and driving to the surgery eating a piece of toast on the way.This morning a phone call asks me to stop on the way to see a lamb which is"tucked up"so a case of enteritis is dealt with on the roadside. At morning surgery two pups are vaccinated,a cat with a bite wound and a ewe having difficulty lambing are seen to,and a glance at the day book reveals two phone calls to be made before a welcome cup of coffee.At ten o'clock I drive six miles to a farm where every bovine has been rounded up for the annual ministry test.
